alert.note: Alert for West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued May 02 at 3:38PM MDT until May 04 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINES IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST AND EAST CENTRAL PLAINS, NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS AND SANDIA, MANZANO AND GALLINAS MOUNTAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING TUESDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL MID EVENING FOR ALL AREAS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH WEDNESDAY FROM MID MORNING UNTIL MID EVENING ALONG AND EAST OF THE CENTRAL MOUNTAIN CHAIN, AND IN THE WEST CENTRAL HIGHLANDS, DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Winds will weaken with sunset this evening, then strong winds will develop areawide Tuesday as a storm system passes mainly to the north of New Mexico and a deep surface trough develops in the lee of the southern Rockies. Very low humidities and an unstable atmosphere with above normal temperatures are also expected areawide Tuesday. Although strong winds will return to most locations Wednesday, cooler and more stable conditions are forecast for northwest areas, while southern and eastern areas remain warm, very dry, and unstable with persistent critical fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM MDT TUESDAY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from noon to 9 PM MDT Tuesday. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued. This Fire Weather Watch is in effect from Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...West Central Highlands Tuesday afternoon until mid evening, and Wednesday from mid morning until mid evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph Tuesday, then shifting out of the west and northwest Wednesday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...7 to 10 percent both days. * IMPACTS...Outdoor burning should not be done. Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
